values.value: NIST 800-53 AU-2 (Audit Events) requires organizations to create, protect, and retain information system audit records to enable monitoring, analysis, investigation, and reporting of unlawful, unauthorized, or inappropriate activity. All security-relevant events must be logged with sufficient detail.
NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5 AU-2 - Audit Events, AU-3 - Content of Audit Records

1. Enable Field History Tracking on all sensitive objects (PII, financial data, access controls). 2. Configure Setup Audit Trail with 180+ day retention. 3. Enable Event Monitoring (if Shield is available) for comprehensive logging. 4. Document audit log review procedures and assign responsibilities. 5. Implement automated alerts for critical security events. 6. Ensure audit logs are tamper-evident and protected from unauthorized access.
